text: Elwood Passenger and Freight Depot, also known as the Elwood Train Depot, was a historic train station located at Elwood, Madison County, Indiana. It was built in 1894 by the Norfolk and Western Railway. It was a 1 1/2-story, Richardsonian Romanesque style yellow-orange brick building with a steeply pitched hipped roof. It was officially retired from service in August 1975. Note: This includes Passenger Depot torn down in June, 1983. The Freight Depot was burned in a control fire on January 5, 1990. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1980 and delisted in 1984. ==References== Category:Former National Register of Historic Places in Indiana Category:Railway stations on the National Register of Historic Places in Indiana Category:Richardsonian Romanesque architecture in Indiana Category:Railway stations in the United States opened in 1894 Category:Norfolk and Western Railway stations Category:National Register of Historic Places in Madison County, Indiana Category:Transportation buildings and structures in Madison County, Indiana
title: Elwood Passenger and Freight Depot
